Description: Exquisite. Iconic. Historic. This property is more than just an elegant residence; it’s a chapter of local history, a hidden paradise in the Ponderosa pines, a retreat from the chaos and stress of ordinary life, a gathering place for the people and pursuits that matter most.   This site was selected and the original home built by Robert Norris, a local legend and the original Marlboro Man.   Nestled at the edge of Black Forest and facing Pikes Peak, the property features every comfort and luxury. From the moment you come down the tree-lined drive through the automatic gates, you're enveloped with the peace and calm of the surrounding forest, the serenity of the Rocky Mountains and the quiet comforts of home.   While Norris completed his home here in 1961, the current owners took the home down to the studs for a no-expense-spared remodel and update completed in 2008. The result is an exemplary nod to modern luxury: high-quality, low-maintenance finishes that are elegant, yet worry-free.   The master suite and connecting bedrooms share a private courtyard with a fountain and outdoor fireplace, and overlook the home's tennis and pickleball courts, saltwater pool, grand lawns and lush landscaping.   Guest suites include private bathrooms and easy access to the entertaining wing off the loggia, including a theater and an indoor four-season arena for ice skating or hockey in the cooler months, and anything else you can imagine year round: equestrian training, sports, a car collection or whatever your heart desires.   You won't find a better location: just a couple of minutes from I-25 and Colorado Springs' newest dining, entertainment and shopping developments, an hour's drive to DIA, 40 minutes to Denver's major shopping, healthcare and business centers, 30 minutes to Colorado Springs Airport.

Description: Breathtaking views await you in this 4 bedroom 8650 sq ft. executive estate. Perched on a bench above the valley floor, you will find peace and quiet on this 40 acres of paradise. Passing the water feature, the home welcomes you to the great room and the ever-present views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. The kitchen, just off the great room is an open concept thoughtfully designed for entertaining both large gatherings and casual life at the expansive kitchen bar. For more intimate dining, there is a separate dining room with rounded windows providing even more spectacular views. Cathedral ceilings highlight the beautiful iron work in the main room mirroring the surrounding mountain scenery. The great room is anchored by a large, floor to ceiling fireplace ideal for warming up with a good book. On the western side of the home, you will find the first bedroom with an ensuite bathroom just off the main foyer. Down the hallway you are led to the main bedroom wing complete with a massive walk-in closet, cathedral ceilings, fireplace, beautiful mural, and immediate access to the hot tub deck. The ensuite bath is unique with his and hers setup for virtually everything from showers, separate toilets, and centrally placed large tub as well as a rain shower set in an artistic rock structure. Upstairs you will find a seating area with a large bedroom to the west that could double as a flex space for whatever you desire. On the opposite side of the seating area is another bedroom with an ensuite and eastern views. Downstairs is a walkout basement that is more than just a game room, it is home to a full gym, wet-bar, game/seating area, a brand new remodeled 3/4 bathroom, as well as an office that offers more inspiring views. Each level of this home has access to multiple decks, patios, and balcony options to take it all in. This home was designed by renowned local architect, Rick Finney, in 1999 with timeless interior and exterior finishes that stand the test of time. With that being said, the owners have taken great care to maintain the quality feel of the home over time. Embracing the Colorado mining history, you will see a few features harkening back to the days of mining carts, tracks, and mining structures for an authentic feel throughout the property. The home features many updated and thoughtful remodels. Some of the highlights are all new Trex decking, a new roof in 2019, the entire exterior was recently stucco-ed in 2019, a complete replacement of the boiler system in 2010 to a more efficient version, remodeled guest bathroom in the game-room, a remodeled shower in upstairs guest bedroom and new carpet in the gym, office, and the main bedroom closet. In the kitchen, you will find two new dishwashers, a new ice maker, and even a new trash compactor. This home is entertainment ready! National Forest surrounds this home with easy access to extensive trails straight from the property. Tripp Creek to the north of the home has two seasonal waterfalls you can hear from the house. It’s that peaceful here. The home’s location up high on the ridgeline also allows the faint whistle of the Durango Narrow Gauge train to lend to the romantic western vibe of the area. The adjacent national forest provides many wildlife viewing opportunities, from deer, elk, fox, turkey, bear and even duck on the pond found in the meadow below the home. With all the trails this makes a spectacular horse property! (only parcel approved for horses in the development). The area is known for archeological finds in nearly every direction. Come see why this is the ideal place to soak up the Colorado peace and quiet
